content.raw:
It would be nice to have a way to use these widgets while reviewing the pull request, what do you think of adding a widget to the `Plot` plugin? It's a bit hard to tell what it does and how it's supposed to be used without seeing it.

If I may make a broader suggestion, how about starting with the higher level plot widgets and incrementally adding more details? For example, `gazebo::gui::PlotWindow` can have several `PlotCanvas`, and a `PlotCanvas` will have 2 `VariableContainer`s and an `IncrementalPlot`... We could start by porting an empty canvas.
content.html:
It would be nice to have a way to use these widgets while reviewing the pull request, what do you think of adding a widget to the Plot plugin? It's a bit hard to tell what it does and how it's supposed to be used without seeing it.

If I may make a broader suggestion, how about starting with the higher level plot widgets and incrementally adding more details? For example, gazebo::gui::PlotWindow can have several PlotCanvas, and a PlotCanvas will have 2 VariableContainers and an IncrementalPlot... We could start by porting an empty canvas.

There are quite a few layers here which I don't think are necessary. For example, `mainLayout` has a `mainFrame` which has a `multiLayout`. I think we could just rename `multiLayout` to `mainLayout` and get the same result.

We can keep it like this and address this later like you mentioned with the other details.

We can keep it like this and address this later like you mentioned with the other details.

content.raw:
I added a few more tests in f513af3. The remaining functions are our Qt overwritten functions for receiving mouse events. I tried to generate Qt mouse events for simulating a drag & drop from a variable pill into another one but didn't have any luck. My strategy is:

* Generate a left click event over the first variable pill.
* Generate a mouse move event or multiple from the first variable pill to the second one (with the left button pressed).
* Generate a release button event.

The main problem is that `drag->exec()` blocks my thread after some mouse move events. This happens when the drag mouse event is starting.

I played with other alternatives using a helper QT class where I can have signals, slots and call `QTimer::singleShot()` as other experiments but didn't work either. I'm more than open to suggestions but I ran of ideas at this point. [Here](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/branch/plot_2_dragAndDrop) is the branch with some of my experiments in case someone wants to take a look. `VariablePillContainerTest::VariablePillEvents` has the main drag and drop test.
content.html:
I added a few more tests in f513af3. The remaining functions are our Qt overwritten functions for receiving mouse events. I tried to generate Qt mouse events for simulating a drag & drop from a variable pill into another one but didn't have any luck. My strategy is:

  • Generate a left click event over the first variable pill.
  • Generate a mouse move event or multiple from the first variable pill to the second one (with the left button pressed).
  • Generate a release button event.

The main problem is that drag->exec() blocks my thread after some mouse move events. This happens when the drag mouse event is starting.

I played with other alternatives using a helper QT class where I can have signals, slots and call QTimer::singleShot() as other experiments but didn't work either. I'm more than open to suggestions but I ran of ideas at this point. Here is the branch with some of my experiments in case someone wants to take a look. VariablePillContainerTest::VariablePillEvents has the main drag and drop test.

content.raw: On this function, we check `maxSize` straight away, but on the function below, we only check `maxSize` if the variable is being added to the container, but not if it is added to a child multi-variable pill. I think it should be consistent.
content.html: On this function, we check maxSize straight away, but on the function below, we only check maxSize if the variable is being added to the container, but not if it is added to a child multi-variable pill. I think it should be consistent.

content.raw: Actually both these functions are doing different things, but they're public functions which may be used the same way mistakenly. For example, adding by name connects signals, but adding an existing variable won't connect any signals.
content.html: Actually both these functions are doing different things, but they're public functions which may be used the same way mistakenly. For example, adding by name connects signals, but adding an existing variable won't connect any signals.

content.raw: I've refactored these functions in 142033e.
content.html: I've refactored these functions in 142033e.

content.raw: One of the things I worry about the way these classes implement their own parent/child relationship instead of using Qt's functions is that we never delete removed variables, so there is certainly some memory leaking going on. Qt would nicely handle that for us.
content.html: One of the things I worry about the way these classes implement their own parent/child relationship instead of using Qt's functions is that we never delete removed variables, so there is certainly some memory leaking going on. Qt would nicely handle that for us.

I have some preliminary tweaks on f489886, feel free to merge those which make sense to you. In summary:

* Improved documentation of some functions / classes
* Removed private member variables which are not used
* Calling signals instead of using `emit`
* Added `this->` to connects
* Added a few test expectations

We can tackle this once the whole plot widget has been ported.
